title: Sources: Civale to ChiSox after bullpen pushback
content: The Brewers are trading Aaron Civale, who resisted Milwaukee's attempt to move him to the bullpen, to the White Sox for first baseman Andrew Vaughn, sources told ESPN.

title: Report: Cops looking to arrest ex-NFL WR Brown
content: Law enforcement in Miami-Dade County is seeking to arrest former NFL wide receiver Antonio Brown on a charge of attempted murder.

title: Agent: Skaggs named Reds' Miley as drug supplier
content: The agent of the late Tyler Skaggs said in a deposition that Skaggs told him he was using pain pills containing oxycodone that were provided by Reds left-hander Wade Miley.

title: Brewers rookie allows no hits, then forced to exit
content: Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski left his major league debut when he slipped on the front part of the mound after holding the Cardinals hitless through five innings Thursday night.

title: Cubs' Crow-Armstrong hits 'cool' out-of-zone HR
content: Cubs center fielder Pete Crow-Armstrong thought it was "cool" to hit the farthest pitch from the strike zone for a home run in MLB this season.

title: Sources: Liverpool agrees to $157M Wirtz deal
content: Liverpool have agreed to sign Bayer Leverkusen's Florian Wirtz in a deal that could rise to a British transfer record fee of ¬£116m, sources have told ESPN.

title: Draisaitl's OT winner caps historic Oilers comeback
content: Leon Draisaitl's fourth overtime goal this postseason sealed a dramatic Game 4 victory for the Oilers, who tied the Stanley Cup Final against the Panthers at 2-2.

title: Death of Gardner's son still under investigation
content: More than two months after the death of Miller Gardner, the 14-year-old son of former Yankees outfielder Brett Gardner, authorities in Costa Rica say the case remains under investigation.

title: Pulisic: Former USMNT critics 'way out of line'
content: AC Milan and United States men's national team midfielder Christian Pulisic said that comments from former U.S. players criticizing him for opting to skip the Concacaf Gold Cup are "way out of line."

title: Frank: 'Left a big piece of my heart in Brentford'
content: Thomas Frank has penned an emotional letter to Brentford following the confirmation of his departure from the club after nine years with the club.

title: Walker: I'd give up a PL title for Spurs trophy
content: Kyle Walker has revealed that he would give up one of his Premier League titles to be able to say he won a trophy at Tottenham.

title: Boca's Costa out for CWC after U.S. visa denied
content: Boca Juniors defender Ayrton Costa will miss the Club World Cup after he was denied a visa to enter the United States, the Argentine team said Thursday.

content: U.S. Customs and Border Protection said it regularly provides security at big sporting events in response to questions about the agency's presence at the FIFA Club World Cup amid President...

content: Arsenal and Manchester United target Viktor Gy√∂keres has said he will talk about his future "when the time is right," hitting out at reports over an ongoing rift between him and his club, Sporting CP.

content: Pep Guardiola has said he would have been sacked by Barcelona or Real Madrid if he encountered similar struggles to those he faced at Manchester City this season.

content: With the Pacers up 2-1 on the Thunder in NBA Finals here are the updated odds to win the championship and Finals MVP.

content: Max Verstappen heads to the Canadian Grand Prix on the brink of a one-race ban with one more infringement could see him miss out on valuable championship points.

title: What May Have Led To Air India Dreamliner Crash? Here Are 4 Scenarios
content: To the naked eye, everything seemed fine when the Air India Boeing 787-8 accelerated during its take-off roll in Ahmedabad airport on Thursday. The next few seconds, however, indicated the plane could be in trouble as it did not gain altitude.

title: Teen Sleeping Near Family's Tea Stall Among Those Killed In Air India Plane crash
content: Fourteen-year-old Akash Patni was sleeping under a tree near his family's tea stall close to the BJ Medical College hostel building in Meghaninagar area when a cruel twist of fate pulled him in as a statistic in one of aviation's worst disasters.

title: He Came To India To Fulfil Wife's Last Wish, Died In Plane Crash On Way Back
content: A tragic plane crash killed 241 people on board a London-bound Air India flight seconds into take-off in Ahmedabad Thursday afternoon.

title: Monsoon Likely To Cover Most Parts Of Northwest India By June 25: Report
content: The southwest monsoon, which regained momentum this week, is expected to cover most parts of northwest India, including Delhi, by June 25, well ahead of the usual dates, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

title: He Came To India To Fulfil Wife's Last Wish, Died In Plane Crash On Way Back
content: He had come to India to fulfil his wife's last wish and immerse her ashes in a pond in her ancestral village. Little did he know, when he boarded a plane back to London from Ahmedabad, that he would not make it back home to his daughters either.

title: Israel Attacks Iran News LIVE: Sirens Sound In North Israel: Military
content: Israel Attacks Iran Live Updates: A new explosion was heard at a key uranium enrichment site in central Iran on Friday morning, hours after Israel launched unprecedented air strikes against the Islamic Republic's nuclear programme.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash Live: Black Box Recovered, 10 From Medical Hostel Dead
content: Ahmedabad Air India Plane Crash Live Updates: A¬†London-bound Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crashed minutes after taking off from Ahmedabad airport, killing 241 people on board. Only one person survived.

title: After Honeymoon Murder Case, Meghalaya To Tighten Residents' Safety And Security Law
content: The Meghalaya government today decided to revisit the Meghalaya Residents Safety and Security Act (MRSSA) in light of the recent murder of a businessman from Indore in the tourist hotspot Sohra.

title: How Black Box's Discovery Brings Investigators Closer To Reason Behind Air India Crash
content: The black box from Air India's ill-fated Ahmedabad-London flight was recovered from the rooftop of the medical college hostel building it crashed into minutes after take-off on Thursday.

title: "Missed It By 40 Seconds": Witnesses Share Horror Of Air India Crash
content: What began as an ordinary day in Ahmedabad turned into a nightmare within seconds, as a deafening explosion in the sky shattered the calm on Thursday.

title: Trump Says Israel's Strikes On Iran 'Excellent', Warns 'Lot More To Come'
content: On June 13th, in Operation Rising Lion, Israel launched a sweeping attack across Iranian territory. They hit multiple high-value nuclear and military targets. The principal target of the attack was Iran's main uranium enrichment site at Natanz.

title: Woman, 30, Killed In Air India Plane Crash Was Flying To London For Husband's Birthday
content: Harpreet Singh (30), a resident of Indore was among the 241 passengers of the ill-fated Air India flight AI-171 that crashed in Ahmedabad on Thursday. Harpreet Singh was going to celebrate her husband Roby Singh Hora's birthday, in London on June 16.

title: Adani Cement, CREDAI Join Hands To Boost Sustainable, High-Quality Construction
content: Adani Cement and the Confederation of Real Estate Developers' Associations of India (CREDAI) on Friday joined hands to advance sustainable and high-quality construction in the country.

title: Black Box Of Air India Plane Recovered From The Crash Site In Ahmedabad
content: The black box of the Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner that crashed immediately after take-off in Ahmedabad yesterday has been found.

title: Anatomy Of A Disaster: Air Force Pilot's Forensic Analysis Of Air India Crash
content: Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner operating as Flight AI171 from Ahmedabad to London's Gatwick Airport crashed shortly after takeoff on Thursday. Out of 242 on board, only one survived. Now the question on everyone's mind is: what exactly happened?

title: Warning, Caution, Worry, Outrage - Global Reactions Pour In As Israel Strikes Iran
content: Reactions from across the world poured in after Israel struck over 100 sites in Iran, including nuclear and military facilities. The attack also saw several prominent figures, including nuclear scientists and Iran's armed forces chief being killed.

title: Air India Plane Crash: Grieving Families Reach Ahmedabad For DNA Testing
content: As Authorities on Friday continued the process to identify through DNA sampling the deceased in the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad, grieving members of the families of Air India Flight Crash victims arrived in Ahmedabad.

title: Iran Retaliates With 100 Drones After Khamenei Warns Israel Over Strikes
content: Iran has vowed a "strong response" after Israel's deadly air strikes hit multiple areas, including military and nuclear facilities, across the Islamic Republic on Friday.

title: Navy's Yashasvi Solanki Becomes First Woman Aide-De-Camp To President
content: Lieutenant Commander Yashasvi Solanki has been appointed as an Aide-de-Camp to President Droupadi Murmu, becoming the first woman officer from the Indian Navy to hold the prestigious position.

title: "Make Deal Before...": Trump's Big Warning To Iran After Israel's Attack
content: Israel pounded Iran in a series of air strikes on Friday, hitting as many as 100 targets, including Tehran's nuclear and military sites. Two of Iran's top Military commanders and at least six top nuclear scientists were killed in the attack.

title: Black box found on hostel rooftop; key to uncovering why AI-171 crashed
content: In a significant development, the black box of the crashed Air India Ahmedabad-London flight has been recovered from a rooftop near the crash site. The tragic incident, which occurred shortly after take-off, claimed the lives of 241 individuals, including Gujarat's former chief minister, Vijay Rupani. An investigation has been launched to determine the cause of the crash.

title: How precise was Israel's strike on Iran? 10 images show how it hit the bull's eye
content: In a stunning operation, Israeli forces launched a surprise assault on Iran, targeting key military and nuclear sites. The attack, aided by covert Mossad operations, involved smuggled weapons and internal sabotage, crippling Iranian defenses. Explosions rocked Tehran, Isfahan, and Qom, resulting in significant damage and the deaths of high-ranking Iranian officials.

title: DGCA orders AI to carry out full safety inspection of its 787-8/9 fleet
content: Following the tragic crash of an Air India Dreamliner in Ahmedabad, the DGCA has mandated enhanced safety inspections for Air India's Boeing 787 Dreamliners, particularly those with General Electric GEnx engines. These checks, effective immediately, include fuel parameter monitoring, cabin air compressor inspections, and electronic engine control system tests.

title: Shooting World Cup: Manu Bhaker flops; Suruchi Singh clinches gold
content: 19-year-old Indian shooter Suruchi Singh clinched gold in the Women's 10m Air Pistol event at the ISSF World Cup in Munich, surpassing France's Camille Jedrzejewski. This victory marks Suruchi's fourth gold and a hat-trick of individual wins. India's medal tally reached three, placing them fourth. Elavenil Valarivan and Sift Kaur Samra secured bronze medals in separate events.

title: Microsoft's top executive to software engineers: If you're going to work with AI-generated code, you need‚Ä¶
content: Microsoft executives emphasize the enduring importance of coding skills in the age of AI. Aparna Chennapragada argues that logical and critical thinking, inherent in coding, are crucial for collaborating with AI systems. Satya Nadella highlights the need for computational thinking and structured instruction, envisioning a future where everyone is a software architect.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Black Box found from AI flight; What it can tell us about tragedy
content: A crucial breakthrough in the Air India Flight AI-171 crash investigation occurred with the recovery of the flight data recorder (FDR) from a medical college rooftop. The London-bound flight crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad, killing 241 of 242 onboard. Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu hailed the recovery as "an important step forward.

title: Exclusive: India's next shooting star? How Olympian dad's words lifted Adriyan to WC medal
content: Adriyan Karmakar, once losing interest in shooting, found renewed passion through his father's guidance. He secured a silver medal in the 50m rifle prone event at the ISSF Junior World Cup in Suhl, Germany. He became the first Indian to achieve this feat. Overcoming equipment issues, he utilised his father's old rifle.

title: Investors lose Rs 8.35 lakh crore in 2 days amid Middle East flare-up
content: Equity markets faced a significant downturn over two sessions due to escalating Middle East tensions and surging crude oil prices, leading to a substantial loss of investor wealth. The Nifty and Sensex both experienced declines, with investor sentiment dampened by geopolitical uncertainty and the impact on sectors like OMCs and financials.

title: Isis plot: Pakistani extradited over NYC terror plan; Encrypted message warned of largest attack on US
content: Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, a Pakistani citizen residing in Canada, has been extradited to the U.S. for allegedly plotting an ISIS-inspired mass shooting at a New York City Jewish community center. The attack, planned for the anniversary of the October 7th Hamas attacks, was foiled through encrypted messaging app monitoring.

title: What caused AI-171 crash? 5 big questions, 2 short videos, zero clear answers
content: Following the AI-171 crash outside Ahmedabad airport, videos have surfaced sparking questions among aviation experts. Pilots are questioning why the landing gear wasn't retracted, and if a dual engine failure occurred due to fuel issues. The final investigation report, due next year, will provide detailed analysis.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Tehran's head of missiles programme killed in Israeli strikes
content: Israel has claimed responsibility for an airstrike that killed General Amir Ali Hajizadeh, commander of Iran's revolutionary guard aerospace force, accusing him of orchestrating attacks against Israel. The strike, part of a broader offensive targeting Iranian nuclear and military sites, has been met with strong condemnation from Iran. Supreme Leader Khamenei has vowed severe retaliation, raising fears of escalating tensions.

title: 200 jets hit 100 targets: How Israel carried out covert strikes deep inside Iran
content: Israel launched a military operation, "Rising Lion," targeting Iran's nuclear and military installations, including the Natanz facility, in response to concerns over Iran's nuclear program. The strikes resulted in the deaths of high-ranking Iranian military officials and nuclear scientists. Iran retaliated with drone launches, and Supreme Leader Khamenei warned of severe consequences, escalating tensions between the two nations.

title: Why did Israel strike Iran? What makes the timing crucial ‚Äì explained
content: In a dramatic escalation, Israel launched a significant attack on Iran, targeting nuclear and military facilities, resulting in explosions in Tehran. The strikes reportedly killed a top Revolutionary Guard leader and nuclear scientists. Prime Minister Netanyahu asserted the operation aimed to prevent Iran from developing nuclear weapons.

title: Assam tension: CM issues shoot-at-sight order; 'groups intend to damage temples'
content: Assam's chief minister, Himanta Biswa Sarma, has issued shoot-at-sight orders in Dhubri after a communal group allegedly desecrated a Hindu temple with cow meat on Eid. Sarma visited Dhubri, vowing zero tolerance for those who desecrate sacred places and promising severe consequences for the perpetrators. He stated he would even guard the Hanuman temple himself if necessary.

title: Sunjay Kapur's demise allegedly after swallowing bee; Saif, Kareena visit Karisma
content: In a day of Bollywood buzz, Aamir Khan confessed to a blackout drunk episode on his 60th birthday post quitting alcohol. Tragedy struck as Karisma Kapoor's ex-husband, Sunjay Kapur, passed away from a heart attack, possibly triggered by a bee sting. Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor were seen visiting Karisma.

title: 'Can't believe Vijaybhai is no more': PM Modi on Vijay Rupani's demise; ex-Gujarat CM died in Ahmedabad air crash
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with the family of Vijay Rupani, the former Gujarat Chief Minister, expressing his deep sorrow over Rupani's death in the Ahmedabad air crash. Modi reminisced about their long association and Rupani's dedication to the BJP's ideology.

title: Pete Carroll fires warning in Raiders camp: 'Everybody's watching you'
content: Pete Carroll, the NFL's oldest coach, emphasizes competition and depth over relying on a single player. He instills pressure in rookies by making them feel constantly observed, pushing them to perform at their best. Carroll praises veteran Raheem Mostert and rookie Ashton Jeanty, excited about their potential contributions to the team's running back rotation.

title: NEET PG 2025 revised exam city list released: Check direct link to download
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has released a revised list of 233 exam cities for NEET PG 2025 on its official website. Following a Supreme Court directive mandating a single-shift exam, NBEMS rescheduled the test to August 3 and expanded city options. Candidates must resubmit their preferences from June 13 to June 17, 2025.

title: Zero-sugar soda cans recalled in the US: FDA cites class II health risk
content: A voluntary recall has been initiated for Dr. Pepper Zero Sugar cans across Florida, Georgia, and South Carolina after it was discovered that some cans were mislabeled and contained full-sugar soda. The FDA has classified this as a Class II health risk, as consumption could pose temporary health consequences, especially for individuals managing sugar intake.

title: One last selfie: Udaipur doctor family's final moments before Air India crash
content: A Rajasthan family's dream of a new life in London ended tragically when the Air India flight crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad, claiming 265 lives. Dr. Komi Vyas, her husband, and their three children were eagerly anticipating their reunion in the UK after years of planning.

title: Israel strikes Iran: Khamenei names new top brass after leaders killed
content: Following Israeli strikes that killed senior commanders, Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei swiftly appointed Mohammad Pakpour as the new commander of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, replacing Hossein Salami. Abdolrahim Mousavi succeeded Mohammad Bagheri as the chief of the armed forces general staff.

title: Watch: Footage shows Israel intercepting Iranian drones; destroying ballistic missiles
content: Israel Defence Forces carried out aerial strikes. The strikes targeted Iranian ballistic missiles. These missiles were positioned to attack Tel Aviv. IDF released video evidence of the operation. A nationwide siren was activated at 3 a.m. This was due to intelligence about an Iranian retaliation. However, the anticipated response did not happen immediately.

title: Ahmedabad plane tragedy: AUS, SA players pay tribute, honour victims in WTC Final
content: The World Test Championship final at Lord's was marked by a sombre tribute to the victims of the Ahmedabad plane crash, with players observing a minute's silence and wearing black armbands. The Air India flight crashed shortly after takeoff, claiming 265 lives. On the field, Australia held a 218-run lead, but South Africa fought back, leaving the match delicately poised.

title: Gautam Gambhir rushes back home due to family emergency
content: India head coach Gautam Gambhir returned home on June 12 as his mother suffered a heart attack on June 11. Gambhir is with his mother at the moment who is undergoing treatment in a Delhi hospital but is likely to rejoin the side before the first Test against England which gets underway on June 20.

title: 'Bold Instagram posts': Punjab influencer's murder linked to moral policing?
content: Punjab Police have uncovered a chilling case of moral policing in Bathinda, where social media influencer Kanchan Devi, known as Kamal Kaur Bhabhi, was murdered. Amritpal Singh Mehro, a Nihang, allegedly orchestrated the crime, objecting to her bold online content.

title: IND vs ENG: Top 5 best Test knocks by Indian batters in England
content: As India prepares for the upcoming five-Test series against England, memories of past batting heroics on English soil resurface. From Rahul Dravid's resilience to Ajinkya Rahane's match-winning century at Lord's, these performances highlight the skill and determination required to succeed in challenging conditions.

title: Why are Iran and Israel sworn enemies?
content: Once allies, Iran and Israel's relationship deteriorated after Iran's 1979 Islamic Revolution, with Ayatollah Khomeini severing ties and criticising Israel's occupation of Palestinian territories. Despite some Iranians questioning this hostility, the current leadership, including Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, maintains an antagonistic stance, even denying the Holocaust. Some supporters of the Islamic Republic criticise Iran's reluctance to directly confront Israel.

title: IndiGo share price today: InterGlobe Aviation stock tanks 6%
content: IndiGo's stock plunged roughly 6% following reports of InterGlobe Enterprises' plan to sell a 4% stake, aiming for $1 billion. This sale occurs amidst Rakesh Gangwal's ongoing share reduction since 2022.

title: India and China to rebuild ties; agree to resume direct flights
content: Vikram Misri and Sun Weidong met in New Delhi to improve India-China relations. They focused on people-centric engagements and resuming direct flights. Progress since their last meeting in Beijing was reviewed. Misri appreciated China's help in restarting the Kailash Manasarovar Yatra. Discussions included sharing hydrological data on trans-border rivers. Both sides aimed to ease visa procedures and promote exchanges.

title: 'We hold Tagore in highest esteem': Bangladesh arrests two over poet's house attack
content: Bangladesh's foreign ministry addressed the vandalism of Rabindranath Tagore's ancestral home. A criminal case was filed, and arrests were made. The government reaffirmed its respect for Tagore's legacy. India strongly condemned the act. West Bengal's Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address the issue with Bangladesh. Authorities are taking legal actions.

title: Op Rising Lion: Israel lifts order for staying near shelters - 10 things to know
content: Amidst escalating tensions over Iran's nuclear program, Israel launched preemptive strikes targeting Iranian nuclear and military sites, resulting in casualties, including key military and nuclear personnel. Prime Minister Netanyahu declared the operation aimed at eliminating the Iranian threat, prompting airspace restrictions and warnings of potential retaliation.

title: Air India plane crash: How do Dreamliner's safety systems work? Closer look at key warning systems
content: An Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner tragically crashed near Ahmedabad, marking the model's first fatal incident and raising safety concerns. The crash revives memories of past battery issues that grounded the fleet in 2013. Despite a strong safety record and numerous warning systems, this event casts a shadow over the Dreamliner's reputation.

title: Loud noise & rush of heat: How seat 11A proved to be lucky; AI crash survivor recalls blurry memories
content: Viswashkumar Ramesh, sole survivor of the AI 171 Dreamliner crash near Ahmedabad, recalls a violent jolt and the pilot's distress call before the aircraft disintegrated. The UK-based businessman, miraculously rescued from seat 11A, now lies in hospital, haunted by the loss of his brother and the devastating tragedy.

title: Pathankot: IAF chopper makes emergency landing in Nangalpur area; second incident in a week
content: An Indian Air Force Apache helicopter landed in Nangalpur. This follows a recent emergency landing near Saharanpur due to a technical issue. In April last year, another Apache was damaged during a hard landing in Ladakh. The Apache is a advanced attack helicopter used by the IAF and Indian Army. It enhances India's combat capabilities, especially in border regions.

title: Israel strikes Iran: Video shows how airspace cleared after attack; watch
content: Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites have triggered widespread air traffic chaos across the Middle East. Airlines are rerouting flights, leading to cancellations and increased fuel costs. Dubai Airport reported significant delays due to airspace closures over Iran, Iraq, and Syria. Iran's Supreme Leader has vowed retaliation, raising fears of a broader regional conflict.

title: 'America was invaded': Trump pushes for 'remigration'; slams Biden, Newsom
content: Donald Trump advocates for the "remigration" of undocumented immigrants, a term linked to far-right European movements, criticizing the Biden administration's immigration policies and California Governor Gavin Newsom. He pledged support for ICE officers and vowed to reverse what he calls an "invasion.

title: Karnataka SSLC 2 results out: Click karresult.in to check result
content: The Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board (KSEAB) has declared the SSLC Exam 2 Result 2025 today. Held from May 26 to June 2, the supplementary exams offered a second chance to Class 10 students who failed or aimed to improve their scores. Results are available at karresults.nic.in; practical exams were conducted on June 3.

title: Common herbal supplement used to beat stress linked to liver toxicity
content: Ashwagandha, a popular herb in supplements, is linked to liver problems, including serious and fatal cases. Reports indicate liver injury occurring weeks after usage, with symptoms like jaundice and dark urine. Experts suspect withanolides may disrupt the liver's detox system. While millions use it safely, moderation and awareness are crucial to mitigate potential risks.

title: Honeymoon horror: Sonam says she was forced into marriage
content: Sonam, along with her accomplices, confessed to murdering her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, in a fourth attempt orchestrated between Guwahati and Sohra. Motivated by a forced marriage, Sonam and her friends plotted the murder in Indore before the wedding.

title: Air India crash: Flying has become safer over decades; last 5 yrs safest since 2000
content: A devastating Air India AI 171 flight crash in Ahmedabad, involving a Boeing 787 Dreamliner, resulted in the loss of almost all 245 on board. According to data from Aviation Safety Network, flying has actually become safer over the last few decades.

title: U.S. and allies driving the world towards turmoil: M.A. Baby¬†
content: CPI(M) general secretary accuses ‚ÄòAmerican imperialism‚Äô of crafting strategies aimed at subjugating and exploiting the Third World countries, including India¬†

title: Five, including Nigerian nationals, held in Hyderabad drug bust
content: All five had earlier served time in Chanchalguda Central Prison, where they met and forged links in a shared barrack. Upon their release, they resumed drug trafficking by leveraging contacts across Mumbai, Goa and Bengaluru, TGANB Director said

title: APSSDC, OMCAP ink MoU with Matrix Overseas to facilitate global job opportunities for Andhra Pradesh youth
content: The programme is designed to align with global workforce requirements and facilitate overseas placements for qualified candidates, says APSSDC official

title: Iran-Israel¬†tension: Israeli PM Netanyahu speaks to PM Modi, other world leaders
content: Israeli PM Netanyahu seeks international support for attacks on Iran, speaks with world leaders including Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Rottela Panduga from July 6 in Nellore
content: Lakhs of people from Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Tamil Nadu are likely to visit Bara Shaheed Dargah during the five-day annual festival to exchange rotis near Swarnala Cheruvu

title: 130 houses partially damaged in Dharwad district, Minister visits rain-hit villages
content: Damage has been reported following incessant rain in the last three days in Annigeri, Navalgund and Kundgol taluks

title: Reward for reporting waste dumping gets heftier
content: Those who report cases will get one-fourth of the fine amount imposed. Government  to remove the current maximum limit of ‚Çπ2,500

title: Foundation stone for health projects worth ‚Çπ440 crore to be laid in Yadgir today
content: The District Stadium has been fully prepared for the ceremony, with financial assistance from Kalyan Karnataka Regional Development Board

title: ED hands over ‚Çπ611 crore worth properties to victims of Agri Gold schemes
content: Among the 397 immovable properties cleared for restitution, 380 are located in Andhra Pradesh, 13 in Telangana, and 4 in Karnataka

title: Aviation watchdog DGCA orders enhanced inspection of Air India‚Äôs Boeing 787 Dreamliner fleet
content: Directorate General of Civil Aviation inspection will include checks of various systems and a review of take-off parameters of the Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft of Air India, owned by Tata Group

title: A tribute transcending political divide
content: CITU headload worker  at Bison Valley in Idukki sculpts a statue  in homage of late Congress leader and Chief Minister Oommen Chandy

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs share higher than Union government‚Äôs in funding for 6 Central schemes
content: Three of these schemes fall under the umbrella of the National Social Assistance Programme ‚Äî Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme, Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme, and the Indira Gandhi National Disability¬†Pension Scheme. The others are the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana-Rural, Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana, and the Jal Jeevan Mission

title: 10 new Govt. Industrial Training Institutes to come up in State
content: Four of them to be established in Pudukottai, Mayiladuthurai, Ariyalur and Tiruchi districts in unserved areas to benefit rural youth, permission accorded to start courses this year

title: Union Health Ministry‚Äôs intervention sought to protect interest of Chandigarh‚Äôs GMCH students
content: Allege violation of NMC norms as GMCH plans to fill 75% of seats under all-India quota for 2024‚Äì25 academic session

title: Kilvelur Agricultural College set for ‚Çπ120-crore campus upgrade in Nagapattinam
content: Forty acres of temple land under the HR&CE Department in Agarakadambanur panchayat, Kilvelur taluk, has been taken on lease for a one-time payment of ‚Çπ3.62 crore for the purpose

title: Three killed, three injured as car ploughs through people in Chittoor district
content: Car driver rams the speeding vehicle into the group of people standing near a bus stop on Chennai-Bengaluru National Highway

title: The troubled history of ‚ÄòBoeing‚Äôs safest aircraft‚Äô, the 787 Dreamliner: A timeline
content: An investigation into the crash is underway and is expected to involve experts from the aircraft‚Äôs manufacturer, Boeing, along with U.S. aviation regulators.

title: Derogatory remarks case: apex court bail to journalist a slap on the face of A.P. Chief Minister Naidu, says YSRCP president Jagan
content: The Chief Minister has created a false controversy to divert public attention from failed governance and deteriorating law and order in the State, he alleges

title: Next-generation food processing a step towards smarter, cleaner and sustainable food system: Kodagu University V-C Ashok S. Alur
content: MoU signed between CSIR-NIIST and Kodagu University for fostering joint research, academic exchange and capacity-building in areas of food processing and life sciences

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Nehru Trophy Boat Race on August 30
content: Organisers mull ways to make the starting and finishing systems flawless from this year‚Äôs race onwards

title: When monsoon magic meets climate chaos
content: Houseboat bookings per vessel have dropped from five per week before the 2018 floods to just one or two during the monsoon season.

title: Jewellers in Kumbakonam allege police excesses
content: A team of policemen came to a jewellery shop on Sarangapani East Street, Kumbakonam, and took the shop owner‚Äôs son and an employee forcibly in their vehicle in connection with a theft in Melmaruvathur

title: Desi Seed Festival in Bengaluru on June 14-15 to showcase over 1,500 indigenous varieties
content: Over 1,500 indigenous seed varieties, including rice, millets, pulses, tubers, leafy greens, and vegetables, will be exhibited. Tribal farmers will also present wild plant resources preserved for generations.

title: Kerala to seek amnesty scheme for declaring wildlife trophy
content: The last opportunity fixed by the Union government for individuals to declare the wildlife trophy in their possession had expired on October 18, 2003.

title: Increase in paddy procurement price fails to enthuse farmers in delta districts
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin, during the opening of Mettur dam on June 12, announced that paddy procurement price would be ‚Çπ2,500 a quintal of ordinary variety and ‚Çπ2,545 for fine variety

title: India abstains on Gaza ceasefire resolution in UNGA, just six months after voting for a similar resolution
content: India‚Äôs weighs participation in France-Saudi conference on Palestine next week, breaks with all other South Asian, BRICS and SCO countries

title: Karnataka: Special Action Force formed to restore communal harmony in three districts, says Home Minister G. Parameshwara
content: A SAF unit, each comprising of 78 personnel, will be placed in the three districts of Dakshina Kannada, Udupi and Shivamogga.

title: India, China agree to expedite resumption of direct flights as ties improve
content: The Ministries' statements came after a meeting of Indian Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Chinese Vice-Foreign Minister Sun Weidong, who is visiting India

title: ‚ÄòRonth‚Äô movie review: An engrossing cop drama that does not miss a beat
content: With ‚ÄòRonth‚Äô, director Shahi Kabir continues to tap into his experiences in the police department, mining uncommon stories which paint an unflattering picture of the force

title: Union Minister Pemmasani directs officials on traffic diversions for Sankar Vilas ROB construction in Guntur
content: The Union Minister assessed the progress of ongoing development works within the city limits and evaluated the status of multiple urban projects launched earlier

title: Proposal for polling stations in high-rises, residential colonies will benefit urban voters, says ECI official
content: As Kerala is significantly urbanised, this arrangement will benefit voters in high-rises, especially in cities such as Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram, says P. Pawan, Deputy Director of ECI‚Äôs Media Division

title: Supreme Court refuses more time to ex-Karnataka minister to surrender in 2016 murder case
content: The trial court declined to interfere in Vinay R. Kulkarni‚Äôs matter on the ground of maintainability in view of the fact that bail was granted to him pursuant to the apex court‚Äôs August 2021 order

title: Air India Ahmedabad air plane crash: Black box recovered from BJ Medical College‚Äôs roof, say sources
content: Ahmedabad Fire Brigade officials informed that a team with specialized equipment like metal cutters was deployed to search the black box in the wreckage at the accident site in Meghaninagar near the airport

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin reiterates ‚Äòzero tolerance‚Äô policy over offences against children, women
content: CM Stalin said there has been increasing awareness and it was evident with the increase in complaints over POSCO offences received in police stations without any fear

title: APATA thanks Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu for proposing Aviation University
content: The association members also appealed to Civil Aviation Minister to set up Udan Yatri Cafes in airports in Andhra Pradesh

title: Nilgiris Collector helps unearth hidden milestone in Nilgiris‚Äô history
content: Over the years, the milestone had become covered with mud, and had even become completely hidden owing to debris being dumped on top of it when the road by which it stands was being repaired

title: Director Sivaranjini J on ‚ÄòVictoria‚Äô entering the Shanghai International Film Festival 2025
content: Victoria, India‚Äôs sole entry to the film fete, deals with themes such as gender, religion, faith, caste and class. The festival is on till June 22

title: Community Resource Efficiency Hub in Kerala‚Äôs Ernakulam to support 25 women-led coastal enterprises build climate-resilient business models
content: A five-tonne capacity deep freezer, a 2-tonne capacity dryer, and two electric autorickshaws, all powered by solar energy, have been installed at the hub to help scale up enterprises, which are mostly into producing fish, agriculture, and dairy products

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder: Raja Raghuvanshi‚Äôs kin seeks narco test on Sonam, her lover to bare ‚Äòfull truth‚Äô
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi is accused of getting her husband killed during their honeymoon with the help of Kushwaha and three contract killers, a case which has sent shockwaves across the country.

title: Air India Ahmedabad plane crash: 10 minutes separated life and death for Gujarat woman heading to London
content: "I am shivering after I learnt about the crash. I left the airport at 1.30pm as I missed the flight due to traffic. I thank God," Chauhan told

title: Supreme Court issues notice to Karnataka seeking response on ‚ÄòThug Life‚Äô ban
content: The Bench recorded a submission that a duly CBFC-certified Tamil feature film was not allowed to be screened in theatres in Karnataka

title: Lone Canadian killed in Ahmedabad plane crash was Indian-origin dentist
content: Canadian dentist Nirali Patel tragically killed in Air India crash, leaving behind grieving family and community in Toronto

title: Madhavrao Scindia to YSR: Political heavyweights, prominent figures who died in air tragedies
content: From Homi Bhabha to CDS General Bipin Rawat, PTI brings the list of politicians and prominent figures who lost their lives in air tragedies.

title: Telangana govt to host event to bring farmers, farm research bodies together
content: Agriculture secretary has urged farmers to avoid overuse of fertiliser as it would affect the soil health and not to burn paddy residue

title: Derogatory speech by Ponmudy: Madras High Court orders notices to DGP, Chennai Commissioner of Police
content: Justice P. Velmurugan also directs the High Court Registry to furnish, to the two officials, copies of an order passed by Justice N. Anand Venkatesh on April 23, 2025

title: Supreme Court orders bail and immediate release of senior journalist Kommineni Srinivasa Rao
content: Supreme Court grants bail to journalist arrested after objectionable comments were made on Amaravati women in a panel discussion he was moderating, sparking controversy and warnings from CM

title: Grading the Rangers, Ducks on the Chris Kreider trade
content: the Rangers sent Chris Kreider and a 2025 fourth-round pick to the Ducks . the new york Rangers could find a replacement elsewhere . there were many reasons that influenced the decision to move on .

title: Fouls, aggression and long shots galore: What it really means to 'get Concacafed'
content: Gab Marcotti and Julien Laurens call out Landon Donovan for his criticism of players pulling out of the USMNT . are you experiencing symptoms of a referee giving you a yellow card for getting punched by another player? have you ever seen a group of ball boys shrug their shoulders and sit, immobile, after a goalkeeper literally punted the ball into the Atlantic Ocean?

title: Aaron Rodgers, back in camp: How the 41-year-old left an impression on his Pittsburgh teammates
content: new: "you broke my heart in the Super Bowl, but I forgive you," he says . new: the 40-year-old has been greeting players at mandatory minicamp for the past five years . the steelers quarterback is a polarizine . he's a longtime fan of the Steelers .

title: Power Rankings: Rays crack top 10 while Braves continue free fall
content: the Rays, Blue Jays and Dodgers are in the top 10 for the first time since week 1 . the Yankees remain in the no. 1 spot after a 2-1 series win against the Cubs, followed by a host of seven national league teams . our expert panel has ranked every team based on a combinatio .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Rutgers part of Big Ten surge
content: the Big Ten is flexing its muscles on the recruiting trail with 10 teams ranked among the top 25 classes . americans still sit at no. 1 while Ohio State pushes to no. 2 after a pair of ESPN 300 additions: in-state RB Favour Akih and DE Khary Wilder .

title: Oakmont is going to be the main character at the 2025 U.S. Open
content: oakmont Country Club has hosted 10 U.S. Opens now -- the most of any course in the country . the clubhouse is dotted with quaint homes . it's a barrier between the idyllic neighborhood and one of golf's most terrifying tests .

title: Sun Belt Conference preview: James Madison looks to close deal this time
content: Coastal Carolina has two in the past five . Georgia Southern is coming off its best season in four years . nearly everyone in the Sun Belt has reached solid to great heights of late . if you have to lose every game, that's an awfully impressive sign of parity and general conference health .

title: The Paul Maurice Effect: How the Panthers coach helped create a monster
content: nosek's fourth-line forward flips a puck over the glass with 1:42 remaining in extra time . he could only watch helplessly from there as Leon Draisaitl scores the game winner . coach Paul Maurice says the feeling wouldn't linger .

title: Pride of the Yankees: Three days with Aaron Judge on the road to immortality
content: Aaron Judge has a four-month-old daughter, nora, his first child . "naps are tough," he said with a laugh . the only safe space in a baseball season is right now .

title: Din Thomas, Anthony Smith spilt on Usman vs. Buckley
content: former champion Kamaru Usman will be back in action for the first time in a year and a half . former champion rose Namajunas will be in action in the co-main event against Miranda Maverick (17-5), who is in the midst of her own four-fight win streak . the welterweight and featherweight divisions also back this week .

title: Oilers strike back, tie series: Grades for both teams, look ahead to Game 5
content: Leon Draisaitl's overtime winner secures a 5-4 win for the Oilers . he scored what appeared to be the game-winning goal for the Edmonton Oilers in the third period . the game was so erratic that even Florida Man likely thought it was too much .

title: What is a superflex league, and why should you try one?
content: the past 12 regular-season MVPs and 14 of the past 19 Super Bowl MVPs have been quarterbacks . the single-season passing touchdown record has been broken three times in the past 21 seasons . modern quarterbacks continue to captivate us with their athleticism .

title: Storylines, top players and predictions
content: college baseball analyst Riggins joins "the Paul Finebaum Show" to discuss the top two remaining seeds going head-to-head in their MCWS opener . this year's tournament brings a mix of competition, featuring teams from six conferences and one independent .

title: The best shots and moments from Round 2 of the U.S. Open
content: The 125th U.S. Open continued Friday at Oakmont Country Club just outside of Pittsburgh. Just 10 players finished the first round at the notoriously difficult course below par, with  J.J. Spaun  entering the event's second day atop the leaderboard at 4-under 66. We have all the best action from the second round of the 2025 tournament right here.

title: PLL Power Rankings ahead of Week 3: Who's No. 1?
